results.title: The Grasshopper: a typical insect
results.brief_description: One of the most common and widely known insects is the grasshopper. Its body structure is show as exemplifying the basic characteristics that identify insects and its life cycle is studied as typical of those insects who go through a process of incomplete metamorphosis. The need for controlling the grasshopper’s destructiveness is also shown.

results.title: The Grasshopper and the ant
results.creator_credit: Lotte Reiniger, Carl Koch and Primrose Productions
results.brief_description: An example of the silhouette films of Lotte Reineger, based on the poem of La Fontaine. All summer long Grasshopper plays his fiddle for other animals and insects to dance, but Mrs. Ant, busy collecting fuel and food, criticises him for his levity. When winter comes he is near death from cold and hunger when a squirrel and a mouse take him in and care for him. He recovers and all including Mrs. Ant join in dancing to his fiddle. Music by Freddie Phillips.

results.title: The Grass is singing
results.creator_credit: Michael Raeburn, Mark Forstater, Svenska filminstitutet and Chibote Ltd
results.brief_description: Set against the overwhelming African bush, Karen Black as Mary Turner plays a desperate woman searching for security and love. Unable to come to terms with herself or the land she lives in, Mary accepts a marriage proposal from farmer John Thaw, rather than remain single in a big city. But this is not the escape she hoped it to be. Based on the novel by Doris Lessing.

results.title: The Grapes of Wrath
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Darryl F. Zanuck, Nunnally Johnson and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Adaptation of John Steinbeck’s famous novel. The dramatic story of the Joad family and their migration to California from their dust-bowl farm in Oklahoma during the Depression. An observance of America during a difficult era, the film reveals considerable compassion for poor, honest people struggling for dignity against seemingly insurmountable odds. Stars Henry Fonda, Jane Darwell, John Carradine and Charley Grapewin.

results.title: The Grand design
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: Shows the beginnings of the United Nations Organization, its political work for peace, and its achievements and aims in the fields of agriculture, health, and famine control Perhaps most inspiring are the sections dealing with economic aid and health projects which show how wide is the UN’s scope and effectiveness it these fields.

results.title: The Grand
results.brief_description: Describes the work done by people of various backgrounds for conservation on the Grand River Watershed in Ontario, Canada. Also gives the background to the work and explains various methods of conservation used in the watershed area.

results.title: The Grain that built a hemisphere
results.brief_description: A study of the part played by maize in the development of both the past and the present civilizations of the American continents. The history of the Americas is graphically presented in terms of the economic and sociological factors which determined the lives of the peoples who inhabited these lands.

results.title: The Graduate (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Lawrence Turman, Lawrence Turman Inc and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Mentally adrift after graduating from college, Benjamin Braddock is pressured by both family and friends to take on the responsibilities of adulthood, namely to marry and find a job. But the exhortation of family friend, Mr. Robinson, to seize every possible opportunity inspires Ben to accept Mrs. Robinson’s offers of sex. Shortly after, Ben is pushed into dating the Robinsons’ daughter, Elaine, and after falling in love with her he finds himself in the compromising position of maintaining a relationship with both women. Also includes a 45 min. documentary on the making of the film. Cast includes: Dustin Hoffman, Anne Bancroft, Katherine Ross, William Daniels, Elizabeth Wilson and Murray Hamilton.

results.title: The Graduate
results.creator_credit: Mike Nichols, Lawrence Turman, Lawrence Turman Inc and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Dustin Hoffman stars as college graduate Benjamin Braddock, who spends his first summer out of school being seduced by the wife of his father’s best friend. He also falls in love with the woman’s daughter to further complicate his life. Nominated for 7 Academy Awards, The Graduate won the Oscar for Best Direction, (Mike Nichols), and its brilliant score by Simon and Garfunkle won 3 Grammies. Ann Bancroft is the memorable Mrs. Robinson, with Katherine Ross as her daughter and rival for Benjamin’s affection. “The Graduate” is a modern comedy classic to be enjoyed again and again.
